intro: Eremosis thomasii, commonly known as the Thomas' eremosis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming a dense cluster. Eremosis thomasii is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare species due to its limited distribution.
